content.title: Scheme for Giving Awards to Junior Artists in Contemporary Art Field
content.details: The 'Scheme for Giving Awards to Junior Artists in Contemporary Art Field' was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to encourage junior artists towards Painting & Sculpture arts by giving an award of ₹10,000/- at the state-level contemporary art exhibition. The Traditional Art / Contemporary Art exhibitions are conducted by Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu at the state level and awarded works will be on display for public view in the exhibition.
benefits: ₹10,000/- award prize money for 30 Junior artists.
eligibility: The applicant should be a domicile of Tamil Nadu.
The applicant should be an artist.
The applicant should be less than 30 years of age.
content.application_process: Offline. Interested applicants should visit the office of the Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu to request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form.

faqs.question: How much financial support does the scheme offer to junior artists?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, junior artists are awarded a prize of ₹10,000/- each for their outstanding work in contemporary art.

faqs.question: How many junior artists benefit from this scheme, and what is the total prize money disbursed?
faqs.answer: A total of 30 junior artists are awarded the prize money, amounting to a cumulative sum of ₹3,00,000/-.

faqs.question: Is there any entry fee associated with the application process?
faqs.answer: Yes, artists are required to pay an entry fee of ₹20/- along with the filled-up application form.

faqs.question: What documents are mandatory to be submitted along with the application form?
faqs.answer: Applicants must provide their bio-data, proof of age, and any other relevant documents supporting their artistic achievements.

faqs.question: Where can applicants obtain further assistance or clarification regarding the application process?
faqs.answer: Applicants can contact the Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu office or refer to the scheme guidelines for any queries or assistance required.

faqs.question: How are the awarded works showcased to the public?
faqs.answer: The awarded works are displayed for public viewing at the state-level contemporary art exhibition organized by Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of receiving the award for junior artists?
faqs.answer: Apart from the financial incentive, receiving the award enhances the artist's reputation, provides exposure, and opens up further opportunities for career advancement in the art field.

faqs.question: Are there any provisions for promoting diversity and inclusion within the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is open to all eligible junior artists, irrespective of gender, caste, religion, or socio-economic background, promoting inclusivity and diversity in the art community.

faqs.question: What role does the Art and Culture Department, Tamil Nadu, play in implementing this scheme?
faqs.answer: The department oversees the administration and execution of the scheme, ensuring its smooth operation and adherence to guidelines.

faqs.question: Can senior artists participate in the contemporary art exhibition organized under this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme specifically targets junior artists below the age of 30 years, excluding senior artists from participation.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of conducting Traditional Art / Contemporary Art exhibitions by Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu?
faqs.answer: These exhibitions provide a platform for artists to showcase their creative talents to a wider audience, thereby promoting appreciation for both traditional and contemporary art forms.
